intro: Phyllanthus australis, commonly known as the Australian phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with simple, alternate leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and sandy environments. Phyllanthus australis is known for its resilience to drought and salt spray, making it well adapted to its native habitat.
